articles.title: Death toll rises to 26 after 'heartbreaking day' as tornadoes hit South, Midwest; more storms forecast: Live updates
articles.description: More dangerous weather was forecast for the South and Midwest after severe storms and tornadoes tore through the area this weekend. Updates.
articles.content: MEMPHIS – The death toll rose to 26 and more dangerous weather was forecast for a wide swath of the South and Midwest already in ruins Sunday from a surge of storms that fueled confirmed or suspected… [+4404 chars]

articles.author: ADRIAN SAINZ and ANDREW DeMILLO
articles.title: Broad swaths of US reel from tornadoes that killed 27
articles.description: WYNNE, Ark. (AP) — Residents across a wide swath of the South and Midwest on Sunday raced to assess the destruction wreaked by storms that dropped possibly dozens of tornadoes and killed at least 27 people in small towns and big cities, as severe weather move…

articles.author: Annabelle Timsit
articles.title: Death toll rises to 26 after storms pummel South, Midwest and Mid-Atlantic
articles.description: The storms are expected to worsen again on Tuesday, with more risk of tornadoes in Missouri and other parts of the Midwest, the National Weather Service said.
articles.content:

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN
articles.title: The US leads the world in weather catastrophes. Here's why
articles.description: The United States is Earth's punching bag for nasty weather.Blame geography for the U.S. getting hit by stronger, costlier, more varied and frequent extreme weather than anywhere on the planet, several experts said.
